explanation: To determine whether metal_generic_dev_dma_map violates the MISRA rule against direct or indirect self-calls we must inspect every function it calls and any functions those call (transitive callees) to see if any path returns to metal_generic_dev_dma_map. Therefore:  - metal_cache_flush: This is directly called by the target. Its body (and any functions it calls) must be examined to ensure it does not call back to metal_generic_dev_dma_map (directly or via other functions).  - metal_cache_invalidate: This is also directly called by the target. Its implementation and any transitive callees must be checked for a path back to metal_generic_dev_dma_map.  (Per the provided static call graph these two have no further callees, but their definitions are still required to conclusively rule out indirect recursion.)
